org.openimaj.math.matrix

Class GeneralisedEigenvalueProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.math.matrix.GeneralisedEigenvalueProblem

  • public class GeneralisedEigenvalueProblem
extends Object
    Methods for solving the Generalised Eigenvalue Problem: A x = L B x.

    Internally the methods in this class use LAPACK to compute the solutions.

    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • symmetricGeneralisedEigenvalues

        public static no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseVector symmetricGeneralisedEigenvalues(no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix A,
                                                             no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix B)
        Compute the generalised eigenvalues, L, of the problem A x = L B x. The returned eigenvalues are not ordered.
        Parameters:
        A - symmetric Matrix A; only the upper triangle is used.
        B - symmetric Matrix B; only the upper triangle is used.
        Returns:
        the eigenvalues L.

      • symmetricGeneralisedEigenvectors

        public static IndependentPair<no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix,no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseVector> symmetricGeneralisedEigenvectors(no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix A,
                                                                                                              no.uib.cipr.matrix.DenseMatrix B)
        Solve the general problem A x = L B x. The returned eigenvalues are not ordered.
        Parameters:
        A - symmetric matrix A
        B - symmetric matrix B
        Returns:
        The eigenvectors x and eigenvalues L.

      • symmetricGeneralisedEigenvalues

        public static double[] symmetricGeneralisedEigenvalues(Jama.Matrix A,
                                       Jama.Matrix B)
        Compute the generalised eigenvalues, L, of the problem A x = L B x. The returned eigenvalues are not ordered.
        Parameters:
        A - symmetric Matrix A; only the upper triangle is used.
        B - symmetric Matrix B; only the upper triangle is used.
        Returns:
        the eigenvalues L.

                                                                     Jama.Matrix B)

      • symmetricGeneralisedEigenvectorsSorted

        public static IndependentPair<Jama.Matrix,double[]> symmetricGeneralisedEigenvectorsSorted(Jama.Matrix A,
                                                                           Jama.Matrix B)
        Solve the general problem A x = L B x. The returned eigenvalues ordered in a decreasing manner.
        Parameters:
        A - symmetric matrix A
        B - symmetric matrix B
        Returns:
        The eigenvectors x and eigenvalues L.

      • symmetricGeneralisedEigenvectorsSorted

        public static IndependentPair<Jama.Matrix,double[]> symmetricGeneralisedEigenvectorsSorted(Jama.Matrix A,
                                                                           Jama.Matrix B,
                                                                           int numVecs)
        Solve the general problem A x = L B x. The returned eigenvalues ordered in a decreasing manner. Only the top numVecs eigenvalues and vectors are returned.
        Parameters:
        A - symmetric matrix A
        B - symmetric matrix B
        numVecs - number of eigenvalues/eigenvectors
        Returns:
        The eigenvectors x and eigenvalues L.
